article_title: China Leaders Announce 12.2% Rise in Defense Spending at National People's Congress in Beijing
article_text:
BEIJING—The double-digit increase in China's 2014 defense budget amounts to the biggest increase in absolute terms in at least a decade—$14.4 billion—and illustrates Beijing's determination to prioritize military spending as the Pentagon faces cutbacks.

The 12.2% rise in military spending unveiled in a government budget plan Wednesday wasn't unusually big in percentage terms; China's defense budget has grown by an annual average of...
